definition: internal trouble and outside aggression (idiom); in a mess both domestically and abroad

sentences.english: No peace, for they are lacking directions.
sentences.chinese: 不平安，因为心中没有方向，内忧外患。

sentences.english: During his life , Southern Song was threatened by both domestic trouble and foreign invasions.
sentences.chinese: 在他生活得年代，南宋一直处于内忧外患之中。

sentences.english: Against this background of internal turmoil and external threat lives a legendary queen.
sentences.chinese: 在此内忧外患之中，生活着一位传奇的皇后。

sentences.english: BUT EVEN as a republic, China remained riven by internal strife and lacerated by external aggression.
sentences.chinese: 但即便在共和制度下，中国依然深受内忧外患的困扰。

sentences.english: And the external trouble roots from the marketing propagation and the discourse hegemony in literary criticism.
sentences.chinese: 外患“则主要指市场的追捧和文学批评的话语霸权。

definition: internal trouble and outside aggression (idiom); in a mess both domestically and abroad
foreign invasion/disaster on border due to incursion
(literary) foreign aggression/external threat/humiliation inflicted by outsiders
lit. calamity within one's bosom (idiom); major trouble hidden within
the people's livelihood is reduced to destitution (idiom); a time of famine and impoverishment
(of a nation) to be destroyed/subjugation/vanquished nation
internal strife/power struggle/(of members of an organization) to fight each other
